revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Chris Diamantopoulos | image = Chris Diamantopoulos 4th Annual Norma Jean Gala (cropped).jpg | imagesize = | caption = Diamantopoulos at the 4th Annual Norma Jean Gala in March 2015 | birth_name = Christopher Diamantopoulos | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1975|5|9}} | birth_place = [[Toronto|Toronto, Ontario]], [[Canada]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Actor, comedian | yearsactive = 2000–present | networth = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Becki Newton]]|2005}} | children = 2 | website = }} '''Christopher Diamantopoulos''' (born May 9, 1975; {{lang-el|Χριστόφορος "Κρις" Διαμαντόπουλος|}}) is a Canadian actor and comedian.
==Career== Diamantopoulos began appearing in TV commercials and professional theatre productions at the age of 9, and by the time he turned 18, he had left home to partake in a series of [[United States|U.S.]] national tours.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0224565/biotitle| title=Biography for Chris Diamantopoulos| accessdate=5 April 2012| publisher=[[IMDb]]}}</ref> A short time later, he worked on [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] where he played leading parts in ''[[The Full Monty (musical)|The Full Monty]]'' (2002) and ''[[Les Misérables (musical)|Les Misérables]]'' (2003).<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.ibdb.com/person.php?id=91699| title=Chris Diamantopoulos| accessdate=11 April 2012| publisher=IBDB: The official source for Broadway Information}}</ref> Diamantopoulos attended [[East York Collegiate Institute]].
He portrayed [[Robin Williams]] in ''Behind the Camera: The Unauthorized Story of Mork & Mindy'' alongside costar [[Erinn Hayes]]. He has guest-starred in several series, including ''[[Kevin Hill]]'', ''[[Charmed]]'', ''[[The Sopranos]]'', ''[[Nip/Tuck]]'', and ''[[Boston Legal]]''. In 2007, he appeared opposite [[Debra Messing]] in ''[[The Starter Wife (miniseries)|The Starter Wife]]'', where he played the role of Rodney, the [[interior decorator]].
Diamantopoulos had a recurring role on ''[[State of Mind (TV series)|State of Mind]]''. He also guest-voiced on ''[[American Dad!]]'' in 2009.
On the eighth season of ''[[24 (TV series)|24]]'', he played [[President of the United States|US President]] [[Allison Taylor]]'s [[White House Chief of Staff|Chief of Staff]] Rob Weiss. He played [[Frank Sinatra]] in ''[[The Kennedys (miniseries)|The Kennedys]]''. Diamantopoulos played [[Moe Howard]] in the 2012 ''[[The Three Stooges (2012 film)|The Three Stooges]]'' film. He also is the current spokesman for the firm Charles Schwab.<ref>sourced: ‘The Three Stooges’: The new Moe speaks for Charles Schwab posted by halboedeker on February 16, 2012 8:55 AM</ref> He understudied Donny Osmond on tour of ''[[Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat]]''.
He had recurring roles on the [[NBC]] sitcoms ''[[Up All Night (TV series)|Up All Night]]'', as [[Maya Rudolph]]'s on and off lover, Julian; ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'', as Brian, a former member of the show's documentary film crew; and on ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]'', as Marky, Lindsay's face-blind environmentalist boyfriend. He is also the voice of [[Mickey Mouse]] for the [[Mickey Mouse (TV series)|eponymous animated series]].<ref name="roto">{{cite web| url=http://www.therotoscopers.com/2013/06/25/disney-shorts-debut-with-new-voice-for-mickey-mouse/| title=Disney Shorts Debut with New Voice for Mickey Mouse| first=Blake| last=Taylor| work=The Rotoscopers| date=June 27, 2013| accessdate=June 27, 2013}}</ref>.
He has recently featured in the UK/US television sitcom ''[[Episodes (TV series)|Episodes]]'' playing the part of TV network boss Castor Sotto, Mr. Chris in the TV adaptation of ''[[About a Boy (TV series)|About a Boy]]'', and billionaire investor Russ Hanneman in ''[[Silicon Valley (TV series)|Silicon Valley]]''.
In 2017 Diamantopoulos starred in the musical ''[[Waitress (musical)|Waitress]]'' on Broadway.
==Personal life== Diamantopoulos grew up splitting his time between [[Canada]] and [[Greece]]. He is of [[Greeks|Greek]] descent and is a practicing member of the [[Greek Orthodox Church|Greek Orthodox]] church.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.undernewmanagement-themovie.com/cast.php |title=Under New Management - The Movie : Wall Street Meets Mob Street - Cast |publisher=Undernewmanagement-themovie.com |date=2009 |accessdate=2014-02-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101111012450/http://www.undernewmanagement-themovie.com/cast.php |archivedate=2010-11-11 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/greenvilleonline/access/2418899691.html?FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Aug+7%2C+2011&author=Lillia%20Callum-Penso&pub=The+Greenville+News&desc=Local+pair+puts+Book+of+Revelation+on+the+app&pqatl=google | work=[[The Greenville News]]| first=Lillia| last=Callum-Penso| title=Local pair puts Book of Revelation on the app| date=August 7, 2011}}</ref> He met his wife, actress [[Becki Newton]], in a [[New York City Subway|subway station]] in [[New York City|New York]]. The couple married on May 12, 2005. Newton gave birth to their first child, a boy, in November 2010.<ref>{{cite journal| url=http://www.usmagazine.com/momsbabies/news/actress-becki-newton-welcomes-baby-boy-2010912| title=Actress Becki Newton Welcomes Son!| date=December 9, 2010| journal=[[US Weekly]]| accessdate=December 22, 2010}}</ref> In 2014 they had a daughter.<ref>{{cite journal| title=Becki Newton: What’s In My Bag?| url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/becki-newton-whats-in-my-bag-2015214| date=April 22, 2015| journal=US Weekly| accessdate=November 14, 2017}}</ref>
